org.forgerock.openig.filter.oauth2.resolver

Class OpenAmAccessToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openig.filter.oauth2.resolver.OpenAmAccessToken
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AccessToken

    public class OpenAmAccessToken
extends Object
implements AccessToken
    Models an AccessToken as returned by the OpenAM tokeninfo endpoint. 
         curl https://openam.example.com:8443/openam/oauth2/tokeninfo?access_token=70e5776c-b0fa-4c70-9962-defb0e9c3cd6
    Example of OpenAM returned Json value (for the previous request): 
         {
         "scope": [
             "email",
             "profile"
         ],
         "grant_type": "password",
         "realm": "/",
         "token_type": "Bearer",
         "expires_in": 471,
         "access_token": "70e5776c-b0fa-4c70-9962-defb0e9c3cd6",
         "email": "",
         "profile": ""
     }

                 String token,
                 Set<String> scopes,
                 long expiresAt)
        Builds a AccessToken with the result of a call to the tokeninfo endpoint.
        Parameters:
        rawInfo - raw response message.
        token - token identifier
        scopes - scopes of the token
        expiresAt - When this token will expires

        public Set<String> getScopes()

      • getExpiresAt

        public long getExpiresAt()
        Description copied from interface: AccessToken
        Returns the time (expressed as a timestamp in milliseconds since epoch) when this token will be expired. If the AccessToken.NEVER_EXPIRES constant is returned, this token is always considered as available.
        Specified by:
        getExpiresAt in interface AccessToken
        Returns:
        the time (expressed as a timestamp, in milliseconds since epoch) when this token will be expired.
